quotes.t: Four decades later we're all blabbermouths, adrift on a sea of {qword}hyperbole{/qword}, shouting to be heard.
Even if we discount the {qword}hyperbole{/qword} evident in such accounts, they were far from inventions.
… balanced on the razor edge of anachronism, creating a rich stew of accepted and invented history, anecdote, myth and {qword}hyperbole{/qword}.

et: Latin, from Greek {it}hyperbolē{/it} excess, hyperbole, hyperbola, from {it}hyperballein{/it} to exceed, from {it}hyper-{/it} + {it}ballein{/it} to throw {ma}{mat|devil|}{/ma}
